intro: Nervilia hemratii, commonly known as the Red-bellied Spleenwort, is a small, evergreen fern belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves that are often reddish at the base, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, including spore-producing capsules, are borne on the underside of the leaves. Nervilia hemratii is a rare and ancient fern species, reflecting its evolutionary history and ecological significance.
